fr.enseeiht.danck.voice_analyzer

Class Finder

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.enseeiht.danck.voice_analyzer.Finder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FinderDefault

    public abstract class Finder
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    A tool responsible for finding from database the best MetaToken compared to a given one (or nothing).
    Author:
    Anaël Megna, Kilian Boulhaïs, Cyrius Nugier

    • Method Detail

      • getFinder

        public static Finder getFinder()
        Returns a clone of the injected Finder. Uses a default one if none has been injected.
        Returns:
        a new Finder instance

      • setFinder

        public static void setFinder(Finder finder)
        Injects the new Finder definition.
        Parameters:
        finder - the new Finder definition (passed as instance)

      • getFinder

        public static Finder getFinder(boolean clone)
        Returns either a clone of the injected Finder, or the Finder itself. Uses a default one if none has been injected.
        Parameters:
        clone - true if the returned Finder has to be a clone
        Returns:
        either a new Finder instance, or the original one

      • findNearestRecord

        public abstract MetaToken findNearestRecord(Field field,
                                            Connector connector,
                                            java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> filters,
                                            float threshold)
        Returns the MetaToken that correspond the most to the defined one, according to some filters and a validation threshold. Can return null if nothing can pass the validation test. Use an MFCCHelper to manipulate
        Parameters:
        field - the field used for the search
        connector - the connector used to do the binding with the database
        filters - the set of filters used for including term to the result
        threshold - the threshold used for detecting that no words are matching
        Returns:
        the closest Metatoken found by the algorithm
